entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Destruct Riff

components.m: A musical instrument worth at least 1 sp

entries: You play a quick and powerful musical performance. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature or object to assail it with the rupturing power of song. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} thunder damage and are pushed 5 feet away from you.
If you hit a construct target, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Divine Avatar

m.text: A crystal or gem containing the soul of a dead god worth at least 100,000 gp

entries: You assume the form of a god of your choosing. You become an avatar of said god, using an appropriate statblock. If one is not otherwise provided, you use the Divine Avatar statblock and if you do, choose from one of the listed domains: Arcana, Death, Forge, Grave, Knowledge, Life, Light, Nature, Order, Peace, Tempest, Trickery, Twilight, or War. You gain certain statistics depending on the domain you chose.

You maintain this form for the duration, until your hit points is reduced to 0 in that form, or until you dismiss the spell as an action. Becoming even the avatar of a god, even for a moment, is a taxing endeavor. You gain three levels of {@condition exhaustion}, which cannot be recovered until you complete a long rest for each individual {@condition exhaustion} level. In addition, you lose the ability to cast spells until you finish a long rest.

spell.name: Divine's Fiery Chains
entries: You launch outward a chain of fire that wraps around a target of your choice that you can see within range. Three additional chains then leap from that target to as many as three other targets, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and can be targeted by only one of the chains.

A target must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage and is {@condition restrained} on a failed save, or half as much damage and is not {@condition restrained} on a success.

A {@condition restrained} creature takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage at the start of its turns and can use its action to attempt to break out of the chains by making a successful Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check against your spell save DC.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, one additional chain leaps from the first target to another target for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Divine's Flames of Life or Death
entries: A wave of fiery energy washes out from a point centered on yourself. Choose either life or death. You can expend one of your Hit Dice and make three rolls using the size of the chosen Hit Die. You take damage equal to the total number rolled as burns envelop your body and your constitution is used to fuel the spell. You then apply one of the following effects depending on what you chose:

{@b Death.} Every other creature in that area needs to make a Dexterity saving throw, taking fire damage equal to the total number rolled plus your spellcasting ability modifier on a failed save, or half as much on a success.
{@b Life.} Every other creature you choose in that area regains hit points equal to the total number rolled plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the number of dice rolled increases by one for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Encore

time.condition: which you take when you see a spell being cast

entries: When you see a 2nd level or lower spell being cast, you can immediately use your reaction to cast that spell, using its range and duration for this spell's. If you do not meet the requirements of the spell, such as having costly material components or a specific prerequisite listed in the spell, the spell fails. The spell also fails if the casting time is not an action or bonus action.
When you cast that spell in this way, it is cast at its lowest level, but uses your spellcasting ability for it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the level of spell you can encore can be one level higher for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Fairy Fun
entries: You summon forth the mischief of the fey and implore various pranks and tricks onto a creature, causing them one of varying effects. Choose a creature that you can see within range, they suffer one of the following effects of your choosing for the duration, or until you end the spell as a bonus action.

entries.name: Hallucinations
entries: The target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they have disadvantage on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on sight, as colorful and misty visions of various fey creatures cloud their vision. At the end of each of the creature's turns, they can repeat their save, ending the effect on a success.

entries.name: Tumbling Fool
entries: The target makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they have disadvantage on Dexterity-based attack rolls and Dexterity ability checks, as they begin to tumble and fool around. At the end of each of the creature's turns, they can repeat their save, ending the effect on a success.

entries.name: Babble of Doom
entries: The target makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, they have disadvantage on Charisma ability checks as they begin to babbling over their words like a fool. At the end of each of the creature's turns, they can repeat their save, ending the effect on a success.

entries.name: Forgetful Idiot
entries: The target makes an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, they struggle to recall specific details on anything, such as a name, yet they always have that feeling of familiarity as if the information is constantly on the tip of their tongue. They have disadvantage on Intelligence ability checks. At the end of each of the creature's turns, they can repeat their save, ending the effect on a success.

entries.name: Beware the Bear
entries: The target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, everyone in their vision appears as a giant, terrifying bear that fills them with a magical fear. The target is {@condition frightened} for the duration. At the end of each of the creature's turns, they can repeat their save, ending the effect on a success.

entries.name: Why is it Always Chickens?!
entries: The target makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, countless chickens flock from out of nowhere and bombard the target, causing them to fall {@condition prone}. This effect repeats at the end of each of the target's turns, until they succeed against it three times, ending the effect.

spell.name: Fey Transformation

components.m: a gilded flower from the feywild worth at least 100 gp

entries: You veil yourself with an iridescent aura that allows you to take the visage of a creature from the feywild. When you cast the spell, you choose one of the following forms to assume: Fuming, Mirthful, or Tricksy.

entries.name: Fuming
entries: Your iridescent aura becomes a fiery aura which empowers you with the following benefits until the spell ends:

items: Your weapon and spell attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage on hit.
You emit bright light out to a range of 30 feet and dim light for an additional 30 feet.
Creatures that hit you with melee attacks take {@damage 1d6} fire damage.

entries.name: Mirthful
entries: Your iridescent aura becomes a shimmering sparkle that makes you more appealing, granting you the following benefits until the spell ends:

items: You have advantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks.

Creatures you choose that can hear you speak must make a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by you until the spell ends, or until you or your allies do something hostile toward them after they were {@condition charmed}.
You have advantage on Charisma saving throws and are immune to being {@condition charmed}.

entries.name: Tricksy
entries: Your iridescent aura becomes a shadowy veil, protecting you from sight, granting you the following benefits until the spell ends:

items: You become {@condition invisible} until the spell ends, or until you make an attack or cast a spell. At the start of each of your turns, you become {@condition invisible} again if you weren't already.
You have advantage on Dexterity and Intelligence saving throws.
If you make an attack roll with advantage, you deal an additional {@damage 1d6} psychic damage on hit.

entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can shift your form to a different one, losing the previous benefits and gaining the new ones until the spell ends. Doing so halves the current duration of the spell.

spell.name: Flames of Avernus
entries: A wave of heat bursts out of your hands originating from the nine hells, incinerating creatures in a 120-foot cone of fire. Each creature within range makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save they take {@damage 20d6} fire damage and are lit on fire for the duration. Creatures who failed take {@damage 5d6} fire damage at the start of each of their turns. As an action, a creature can attempt to put out the flames with a Dexterity ability check against your spell save DC. A creature that attempts this, pass or fail, takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage. On a success, the flames are put out and its effects no longer persist. On a fail, the flames and the spell persists.
On a successful save, the creatures take half the initial damage and are not lit on fire.
A creature who dies while under the effects of the spell has their body immediately turned to scorched ash, leaving behind only any magical items they had in their possession.

spell.name: Gaia's Transformation

m.text: A chunk of rare precious metal worth 1000 gp infused with magical moss, which the spell consumes

entries: You assume a magical form by mimicking the powers of Gaia. Your body becomes stone and moss forms randomly around your body. Choose either Guardian or Warrior. You gain the following benefits depending on what you chose when you cast the spell:

items: You are immune to poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapons that are not adamantine. You have resistance to slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning damage regardless of the source.
You are immune to the {@condition poisoned} and {@condition petrified} conditions.
Your size becomes one size category larger. If you were gargantuan, you become twice as large. As a result, you deal twice as much damage with weapons against objects.
You have a burrow speed of 40 feet and can move through solid stone effortlessly, leaving the earth untampered with as you pass by.
You have a +2 bonus to AC (Guardian), or you have a +2 bonus to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws (Warrior).
All your weapon attacks are magical, and when you make a weapon attack, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.
You gain 100 temporary hit points (Guardian) or you gain 50 temporary hit points (Warrior). If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost.

Your weapon attacks deal an additional {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage (Warrior) or when you're not wearing armor, your AC becomes 20. You can still gain the benefits of a shield while under the effects of this spell (Guardian).

(Warrior) You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn. You ignore this benefit if you already have a feature, like Extra Attack, that lets you attack more than once when you take the Attack action on your turn; (Guardian) or you can use your action to form a protective barrier on any number of allies within 30 feet of you, protecting them from damage from one source reducing that damage to 0 (such as a weapon, spell, a dragon's breath weapon, etc.). This barrier lasts until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Gaia's Wrath

components.m: a small chunk of a meteorite

entries: You conjure a large object made of stone which appears 200 feet above the point you choose. The stone can take any shape or appearance, so long as it is purely made of a form of earth. The object crashes directly onto the point you choose and creates. Each creature within a 60-foot radius makes a dexterity saving throw or takes {@damage 40d6} bludgeoning damage from the debris, or half as much on a success.
Objects in the area automatically take twice as much damage.
A 60-foot radius and 30-foot deep creator is left in the wake of the object, with the object completely destroyed and gravel fills the area, making it difficult terrain

spell.name: Gale of The Primordials

components.m: a wing from a powerful creature, such as an angel or winged beast from the elemental plane of air

entries: A powerful wind builds up from your feet, granting you unmatched flight. You gain a flying speed of 150 feet for the duration. You take no damage as a result of falling and are immune to being {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained} as wind rushes from you, preventing anything from keeping hold of you.
Ranged attacks made against you have disadvantage and automatically miss if you are within their long range distance.

spell.name: Giant's Strength

components.m: a piece of mithral or adamantine worth at least 500 gp

entries: Magical runes appear on your body, empowering you with the might of giants. If your Strength score is lower than 19, it becomes 19 for the duration. If your strength score is being reduced by any effect, the reduction is still applied.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, your Strength score increases by 2 for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Glacial Grip
entries: You release a magical hand made of freezing cold ice toward a creature you can see. Make a ranged spell attack against that creature. On a hit, the hand grasps onto the target and it takes {@damage 1d8} cold damage, and on each of your turns for the duration, you can use a bonus action to deal {@damage 1d8} cold damage to the target automatically, except the turn you cast the spell. Each time the target takes damage from the spell, its speed is reduced by 10 feet. The creature makes a constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Guided Hand
entries: You touch a creature, granting them the ability to strike true. Once before the spell ends, the target can give themself advantage on one weapon attack roll on their turn, as a spectral hand from a comforting source guides their attack. That attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6} radiant or necrotic damage on a hit.

spell.name: Guise of The Blood Witch

components.m: a vile of humanoid blood engraved with arcane sigils worth at least 500 gp

entries: Uttering an incantation, you draw on the magic of the blood witch to transform yourself. You gain the following benefits until the spell ends:

items: You are immune to being {@condition charmed} and have advantage on saving throws against enchantment spells.
Whenever you take damage from a spell or effect originating from yourself, you can choose to not take damage once on each of your turns.
You have a magical flying speed of 30 feet and you can hover.
You gain 30 temporary hit points. If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost.

You can use a bonus action on each of your turns to turn your gaze to a creature you can see within 60 feet. That creature makes a wisdom saving throw or takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage and is {@condition frightened} until the spell ends. They take half damage and are not {@condition frightened} on a successful save.

spell.name: Guise of the Haunted Fey
entries: You veil yourself with haunting lights and illusory sounds, making you look and sound like a horrifying fey creature from the Unseelie court. For the duration, you have advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks.

spell.name: Heart Sunder

components.m: a drop of blood from a humanoid

entries: You fill a creature you choose within range that you can see with necrotic energy. You cause their heart to beat rapidly and then stop momentarily. The creature makes a constitution saving throw taking {@damage 8d6} necrotic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn on a failed save, or half as much and is not {@condition stunned} on a success. Undead and Constructs automatically pass the saving throw of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 and the duration increases by 1 additional round for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Investiture of Water
entries: Until the spell ends, your body takes a watery appearance, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks.
You have a swim speed of 60 feet and can breathe underwater as you do air.
You are always treated as if you were submerged underwater.

You can use your action to create a 10 foot long whip made of water. You can use a bonus action to attack with the whip. When you do, make a melee spell attack with a range of 10 feet. On hit, the water whip deals {@dice 2d4} plus your spellcasting ability modifier bludgeoning damage and the target makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, they are knocked {@condition prone}.

You can use your action to control nearby water to snare your enemies. Choose a creature within 30 feet of a pool of water that is within 120 feet of you. That creature must make a Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained}. You can use a bonus action to drag a creature {@condition restrained} in this way 10 feet closer to the pool. Once the creature is close enough, it can be dragged underneath the pool of water. A creature can use an action to repeat its Strength save, ending the {@condition restrained} effect on a success.

spell.name: Lightning Spear

components.m: an electrified twig

entries: You create a bolt of lightning in your hand and throw it at a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack, on hit you deal {@damage 3d10} lightning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can create one additional bolt and throw it at another creature or the same creature, but it only deals {@damage 2d10} lightning damage on hit. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the second bolt increases to {@damage 4d10} damage.

spell.name: Lightning Whip
entries: You evoke an electrifying whip in your free hand. It is similar in size and shape to an actual whip, and it lasts for the duration. It has the light and reach properties. If you let go of the whip, it disappears, but you can evoke the whip again as a bonus action.

You can use your action to make a melee spell attack with the lightning whip. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d4} lightning damage and it must succeed on a Strength saving throw. On a fail, the target is knocked {@condition prone}.
In addition, you can use your bonus action to make a melee spell attack with the lightning whip, however it instead deals {@damage 1d4} lightning damage on hit instead of {@dice 3d4}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Metronome
entries: You point at a creature you can see within range and use rhythmic movements to build up momentum and damage them. The target makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} force damage and is marked by the spell on a failed save, or half as much on a success and are not marked.

While marked, you can use an action or a bonus action to deal {@damage 2d6} force damage to them, but you can only do so once per round and not on the turn you cast the spell. Each time the target takes this damage, they can repeat their save, ending the effect on a success.
After the first round you cast the spell, if you do not use your action or bonus action to deal damage to the target with this spell, your concentration ends early.

spell.name: Ode of Seasons

components.m: a musical instrument worth at least 50 gp

entries: You perform a magical song that empowers a target within range (you can choose yourself). Choose from Autumn, Winter, Spring, or Summer. The target gains the following benefits depending on what you chose:

entries.name: Autumn
entries: The target has advantage on Charisma ability checks.

entries.name: Winter
entries: The target has resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Spring
entries: The target has advantage on saving throws made to resist being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Summer
entries: The target has resistance to fire damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd or 3rd level, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 1 hour. When you use a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 8 hours.

spell.name: Poseidon's Wrath
entries: You conjure a wave of immeasurable force in a 500-foot-high, 500-foot-long, 100-foot-thick. Every creature and object in the area makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, every creature takes {@damage 12d10} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 12d10} cold damage and are knocked {@condition prone} and pushed to the end of the wave. Objects take twice the amount of damage and automatically fail the save. Creatures that save take only half damage and are pushed only half the distance they normally would be pushed and are not knocked {@condition prone}.

Magical and non-magical fire in the area is immediately extinguished and creatures who took the damage from this spell gains resistance to fire damage for the next minute. Spells that set creatures on fire and persist immediately end on affected creatures.
The area affected is not flooded, as the water dissipates after the spell takes effect.

spell.name: Primordial Mark
entries: Magical runes appear on your body and weapons you are holding. Choose from acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. Until the spell ends, your weapon attacks deal an extra {@dice 1d4}  damage of the chosen type on a hit.

spell.name: Reveal/Conceal

components.m: a pair of glass lenses with drops of spring water

entries: For the duration, you can reveal or conceal the presence of magic on objects within range. Choose reveal or conceal and apply the appropriate effect:

entries.name: Reveal
entries: You can emanate an aura that reveals whether or not there is magic on every object within range. A magical mark appears on the object if it is magical. The mark that appears resembles the school of magic the object is affected by, otherwise a generic mark is created if there is no specified school of magic. The mark remains so long as it is within range of the aura.

If the object is under the conceal effects of this spell, it is suppressed while it is within range of the aura. If the object is being protected by divination magic, like being under the effects of the {@spell nondetection} spell, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the level spell that was used to protect it. If a spell was not used to protect it, the DM determines an appropriate DC. On a successful check, the effect is suppressed while the object is within range of the aura.
You can also reveal a message being hidden by magic, such as from the {@spell illusory script} or the conceal effects of this spell. The message is revealed in a language you understand.

entries.name: Conceal
entries: Choose any number of objects within range, if the chosen objects are magical, they become hidden from divination magic. The objects can't be targeted by any divination magic, perceived through magical scrying sensors, and the magic on them cannot be revealed by the effects of divination magic, such as the {@spell detect magic} spell, except by the reveal effects of this spell.

You can also choose to hide text from a non-magical object. Whether this text is written, carved, or magically scribed onto the object, the text becomes {@condition invisible} or is re-written in symbols that have no real meaning.
Any of these effects remains on the objects until dispelled.
The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

spell.name: Rock Slide

components.m: a small rock

entries: You conjure a series of falling rocks at a point you can see within range in a 15-foot tall, 15-foot-long, and 5-foot-wide line. Every creature in the line makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage and fall {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much on a success and are not knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Scholar's Armament

components.m: A gemstone worth at least 50 gp and a martial or simple weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You imbue magical power into a weapon you are holding. The weapon must have the required gemstone fashioned onto it in some way, whether it is on the pommel or on the blade of the weapon itself. For the duration, you can use your spellcasting ability instead of Strength or Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls of melee attacks using that weapon, and the weapon's damage becomes {@dice 1d4} plus your spellcasting modifier. The weapon also becomes magical, if it isn't already. The spell ends if you cast it again or if you let go of the weapon.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The weapon's damage die becomes a {@dice d6} when you reach 5th level, a {@dice d8} at 11th level, and a {@dice d10} at 17th level.

spell.name: Shielding Vitality

time.condition: which you take when you or a creature within range would take damage

entries: You can prevent harm from coming to you or your allies. As a reaction when you or a friendly creature who doesn't have all of its hit points would take damage within range, you can reduce the damage that creature would take by {@damage 1d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Slipstream

components.m: a few drops of oil and water

entries: You create a low-cresting wave of water that carries the target along the surface of water or the ground. The target's walking speed is increased by 20 feet until the spell ends. In addition, swimming does not cost the target any additional movement. If the target had a swim speed, it is increased by 30 feet until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Song of Courage

components.m: a musical instrument

entries: You perform a song of power to rally you and your allies within range with courage. For the duration, you and every willing ally within range that is not {@condition deafened} has advantage on saving throws made to avoid or end the {@condition frightened} condition, also they gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the bonus increases to +2, creatures within range are immune to being {@condition frightened}, and their weapon attacks are treated as magical if they weren't already. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the bonus increases to +3 and creatures within range are immune to being {@condition charmed}.

spell.name: Song of Misdirection

components.m: a musical instrument

entries: You perform a song of power that misdirects your enemies and forces them to focus their attention toward yourself or another creature. Choose a creature within range that you can see (you can choose yourself), up to three creatures you choose within 20 feet of the initial target must make a Wisdom saving throw, regarding the initial target as hostile and the most dangerous threat on a failed save. If the initial target was well-known or friendly to the chosen creatures affected by the spell, they have advantage on the save.

While under the effects of the spell, they are compelled to target the chosen creature with any and all attacks and spells they can utilize. An example of the compulsion could be that they believe that the target has a bounty on their head with a very high reward, but it is up to the DM to determine a proper reason why they would be compelled by the spell. At the end of an affected creature's turn, they can repeat their Wisdom save, ending the effect on a success. The spell ends early if the initial target is reduced to 0 hit points or dies.
A creature is immune to the effects of the spell if they are immune to being {@condition charmed}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can choose one additional creature to make a save against the spell for each slot level above 2nd. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. Using a spell slot of 8th level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

spell.name: Static Discharge

components.m: a copper rod

entries: Electric energy builds up within you and you release it outward in a powerful burst of energy. Each creature (except yourself) within range makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d8} lightning damage  and is {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn on a failed save, or half as much on a success and is not {@condition stunned}.

Rather than using it's normal casting time, you can instead spend your entire turn building up energy and cast it immediately at the start of your next turn, taking up your action for your next turn. When you do so, creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw and you add two additional damage dice. In addition, the radius is increased by an additional 5 feet. See 'Longer Casting Times' on page 202 of the Player's Handbook for reference on casting a spell for longer than 1 action.
Charging the spell leaves you fatigued for a time. You gain one level of {@condition exhaustion} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Static Smite
entries: The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon crackles with electricity, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 1d10} lightning damage. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial extra damage dealt by the attack increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Suffocating Sphere
entries: You attempt to draw the air out of a creature you can see within range. A creature is unaffected by the spell if it does not need to breathe. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature immediately starts to suffocate and begins choking. It can survive for a number of rounds equal to its Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 round). After the previously mentioned rounds have passed, at the start of its next turn, it drops to 0 hit points and is dying, and it can't regain hit points or be stabilized until it can breathe again.

At the end of every round before it is reduced to 0 hit points, the creature can repeat its Constitution saving throw, ending the spell on a success. Once the creature is reduced to 0 hit points, you concentrate on the spell until the creature dies or until the duration ends.

spell.name: Summon Vengeful Spirit

m.text: humanoid blood inside a precious diamond worth at least 600 gp

entries: You call forth a vengeful spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the Vengeance Spirit stat block. When you cast the spell, choose Slain, Cursed, or Betrayed. The creature resembles a vengeful spirit of the chosen type, which determines certain traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge} action and uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Symphony of Law and Chaos

components.m: A musical instrument with clockwork and gears on it worth at least 500 gp

entries: You begin performing a powerful symphony which empowers you with the planes of law or chaos (your choice), your movements as rhythmic as clockwork. You gain the following benefits until the spell ends:

items: Your walking speed increases by 30 feet.
You are immune to poison damage  and have immunity to the {@condition poisoned} condition.
Clockwork wings appear on your back, giving you a flying speed of 50 feet and you can hover.

You are immune to the {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition stunned}, {@condition grappled}, and {@condition restrained} conditions (Chaos) or when you deal damage with a weapon or spell, that creature is also {@condition restrained} by clockwork contraptions until the end of your next turn (Law).

When you deal damage to a creature with a weapon or a spell, you can deal an additional {@damage 2d10} psychic damage to one of the damage rolls (Chaos) or an additional {@damage 2d10} force damage to one of the damage rolls (Law).

spell.name: Thunderstomp
entries: You stomp your foot or strike your weapon against the ground, creating a ripple of power that you can use to knock down your foes. Choose a creature within range, that creature must make a Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone} and take {@damage 4d6} thunder damage, or half as much on a success and are not knocked {@condition prone}. You and the creature must be on the same solid surface, otherwise the spell fails.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Unseelie Moon

components.m: teardrops of a fey from the unseelie court

entries: You create a small moon, which hovers around you, that emanates a dark blue hue. When you cast the spell, and as an action on subsequent turns, you can launch a freezing ray of light from the moon toward a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On hit, the ray deals {@damage 4d8} cold damage and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.
While the moon hovers around you, magical darkness within the area of the spell is treated as regular darkness.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can fire an additional ray from the moon for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Vile Mark

components.m: a drop of humanoid blood

entries: You bestow a vile curse onto a creature you can see within range, making them more susceptible to damage for the duration of the spell. The affected creature is {@condition poisoned} and once every turn, whenever an affected creature takes damage, they take an additional {@damage 2d4} necrotic damage to one of the damage rolls of the source. A creature still suffers the damage even if they are immune to being {@condition poisoned}.
An affected creature can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the spell on a success. The spell can also be ended early with a {@spell Remove Curse}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d4 for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Ward of Vitality

components.m: a trinket or holy symbol made of gold or silver worth 500 gp

entries: For the duration, up to eight willing creatures gain 20 temporary hit points. If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost. While they have these temporary hit points, they have advantage on Constitution and Wisdom saving throws and their hit point maximum cannot be reduced.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the temporary hit points gained is increased by 10 for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Warding Mark
entries: You create a small rune which emits a barrier which can potentially protect you from a single attack. Until the start of your next turn, you have +1 bonus to your AC against the next attack targeted at you.

spell.name: Water Splash
entries: Each creature in a 5-foot radius of a point you choose within range makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, they take {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage and are pushed 5 feet away from the center.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Water Whack

components.m: a cup of water

entries: Water wraps around your hand and you wave it at a creature, slamming it into them. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within range. On hit, the target takes {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage and makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, they pushed back 5 feet and are knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Weightless Form

components.m: a tiny feather

entries: You become lighter than a feather. You and everything you are wearing and carrying become completely weightless, removing your tether from gravity. If you stop wearing or carrying an object, they regain their weight.

For the duration, you have a magical flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover. In addition, you are immune to being {@condition prone} as you float back onto your feet at the cost of no movement and take no damage as a result from falling. Anytime you are hit by an attack, you are pushed back 10 feet away from the attacker.
If you are still flying when the spell ends, you safely descend at a rate of 60 feet per round until you touch the ground.

spell.name: Whelm

components.m: A vile filled with water from a waterfall

entries: You conjure an overwhelming amount of water that crashes onto a creature you can see within range with crushing force. That creature must make a Strength saving throw, or fall {@condition prone} and are {@condition restrained}. A flying creature is forced to the ground, but only takes half the normal amount of fall damage they would have received. At the start of each of the target's turns it takes {@dice 1d10} points of bludgeoning damage. At the end of the creature's turns it can repeat its saving throw, ending the spell on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Winter's Grasp

components.m: a frozen monster claw

entries: Ice encrusts the ground radiating a powerful cold energy in a 15 foot radius, making it hard for creatures to maintain their balance. This icy ground is treated as difficult terrain. A creature that begins its turn in the affected area takes {@damage 2d6} cold damage and makes a dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they fall {@condition prone}. At the end of their turns, they make a constitution saving throw. On a successful save, they become immune to the spell's effects.
The cold freezes nonmagical liquids in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Yeti's Chilling Gaze
entries: Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} cold damage and is {@condition paralyzed} for the duration, unless the target is resistant or immune to cold damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target. If a creature passes their save against this spell, they are immune to its effects for 1 hour.
